-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | Instances for using gsl-random with random-fu
--   
--   Instances for using gsl-random's RNG type as a random-fu RandomSource.
@package gsl-random-fu
@version 0.0.0.1

module Data.Random.Source.GSL
wrapRNG :: RNG -> IO WrappedRNG
newWrappedRNG :: RNGType -> IO WrappedRNG

-- | <a>RNG</a>s may not produce random words in the full range of Word64.
--   Therefore, <a>getRandomWordFrom</a> requires that the range of the
--   generator be checked, and if it does not produce the full range,
--   multiple samples will be taken to produce a suitable <a>Word64</a>.
--   The triage part will be done every time if sampling from a raw
--   <a>RNG</a>. Using <a>WrappedRNG</a> allows that triage to be done
--   ahead of time, speeding up sampling integral values at the expense of
--   an unwrap when sampling <a>Double</a>s.
data WrappedRNG
instance RandomSource IO RNG
instance RandomSource IO WrappedRNG
